title: Frank Lloyd Wright Robie House
creator_credit: Edward Hayward, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
brief_description: Shows the evolution of Frank Lloyd Wright’s “prairie house” style, culminating in the Robie house in Chicago, 1908. Includes a detailed examination of the interior of the house, with the use of still shots. This film is part of a third level course series from the Faculty of Arts, open University, intended to investigate the architect and design of the period 1890-1939.
